## LECTURES

### [January 21]{.in-person} Introduction to Population Health

-   Foundations of population health
-   what it is, how it's measured, and what drives it.
-   Through case studies and group work, you explore determinants, disparities, and interventions from policy to individual care.
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/week1IntroPopHealth/)

### [January 26]{.online} Structural Foundations of Health

-   Why do some populations experience better health than others?
    -   social gradient
    -   structural inequities
    -   social context
    -   economic context
    -   environmental context
    -   housing
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/StructuralFoundationsHealth/)

### [January 28]{.in-person} Structural Foundations of Health (part 2)

-   Why do some populations experience better health than others?
    -   Policy & health
    -   Labor conditions
-   Community vs. population assessments
-   Group exercise
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/StructuralFoundationsHealth2/)

### [February 2]{.in-person} Population Health Theories and Frameworks

-   Socio-ecological model
-   Life course perspective
-   Biopsychosocial model
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/populationHealthTheoriesAndFrameworks/)

### [February 4]{.in-person} Population Health Theories and Frameworks (con't)

-   Pathways from determinants to health outcomes
-   How do various determinants interact?
-   In-class exercise: identifying *moderators* and *mediators* on a causal pathway
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/populationHealthTheoriesAndFrameworks2/)


### [February 9]{.in-person} Measuring Health and Disease in Populations

-   Rates, ratios, proportions
-   Incidence and prevalence
    -   Population structure (age pyramids)
    -   Demographic changes: fertility, mortality, migration
    -   Preston curve: GDP vs. life expectancy
    
-   In-class exercise: age pyramids
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/measuringHealthAndDisease26)


### [February 11]{.in-person} Measuring Health and Disease in Populations (con't)

-   Demographic and health transition
-   Standardization in epidemiological research
-   Crude death rate
-   Standardized mortality rates
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/measuringHealthAndDisease26)


### [February 16]{.online} Research Skills Workshop

-   How to access health data and library resources
-   Explore datasets (CDC, WHO, County Health Rankings)
-   APA citation and writing format
-   Bibliography tools


### [February 18]{.offline} Group work

-   Meet in groups in person or online
-   Decide on a topic worthy of investigation
-   Assign responsibilities of each group member
-   Identify sources of prevalence (e.g. by county, state)
-   Identify potential determinants


### [February 23]{.in-person} Measuring Health and Disease in Populations (con't)

-   Constructing life tables and deriving life expectancy
-   Potential years of life lost
-   Combining mortality and morbidity into DALYs
-   [GITHUB Link](https://poph-001.github.io/measuringHealthAndDisease26)
